Take three slow breaths, feel your feet on the ground, unclench your jaw.

> “Let’s hold this for now.”  
> “I hear that urge; let’s pause before acting.”  
They cue both of you toward slowing down without giving directives.

**5. Debrief afterward.**  
When the immediate intensity passes, jot a few notes or share with your own support network—just enough to discharge leftover adrenaline and reaffirm that you stayed within healthy limits.

**6. Keep referral pathways visible.**  
Have crisis lines, professional contacts, or support‑community info ready.

- For other places, look up local equivalents on the *Find a Helpline* directory.
